content: I am seriously concerned about the movement tracking apps that are being deployed everywhere. What data do they use? Where does it go? Are they necessary at all since there is a limit to the precision of mobile phone GPS.

How to solve the balance between the need for privacy and the use of tracking to monitor outbreak evolution is one of the many challenges brought by the current situation.
Current responses by different countries can be a litmus tests on existing attitudes in this respect. See for instance: http://www.top10vpn.com/news/surveillance/covid-19-digital-rights-tracker/

Relevant to this topic is the statement from the European Data Protection Board (19 March):
http://edpb.europa.eu/sites/edpb/files/files/file1/edpb_statement_2020_processingpersonaldataandcovid-19_en.pdf
